Line 32: Line 32:
== Biography ==
== Biography ==
â
[[File:Th alphart.png|thumb|right|100px|Yves Rodier's version of [[Tintin and Alph-Art]].]]
  â  
Rodier always loved comics, but first set out to become a musician or cinematographer. He soon returned to comics. He started out by imitating the work of his favorite author, [[HergÃ©]], creating [[pastiches]] of ''[[The Adventures of Tintin]]''. These copies were illegal and did not earn him much money, though this allowed him to meet many other cartoonists, like [[Bob de Moor]], [[Jacques Martin (comics)|Jacques Martin]] and [[Greg (comics)|Greg]]. In 1995, he met Daniel and Richard Houde, and in their magazine ''Pignouf'' he started his comic series ''Pignouf et Hamlet'', about a boy and his pig. The magazine only lasted for five issues, though the series continued.
Rodier always loved comics, but first set out to become a musician or cinematographer. He soon returned to comics. He started out by imitating the work of his favorite author, [[HergÃ©]], creating [[pastiches]] of ''[[The Adventures of Tintin]]''. These copies were illegal and did not earn him much money, though this allowed him to meet many other cartoonists, like [[Bob de Moor]], [[Jacques Martin (comics)|Jacques Martin]] and [[Greg (comics)|Greg]]. In 1995, he met Daniel and Richard Houde, and in their magazine ''Pignouf'' he started his comic series ''Pignouf et Hamlet'', about a boy and his pig. The magazine only lasted for five issues, though the series continued.
